description:
Redevelopment of existing chapel; Sunday School and nursery hall including partial demolition to Sunday School building to provide new church and nursery accommodation with 14 residential units within the chapel.

This application represents an amendment to the Planning Ppermission and Conservation Area Consent granted in December 2004 (Refs: 2004/3672/P and 2004/3674/C).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - All new externmal and internal works and finishes and work of making good shall be carried out to match the original work as closely as possible in materials, colours, texture and profile, and detailed execution unless otherwise shown in the approved drawings or within documentation hereby approved or required by any condition attached to this permission.

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policies EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - The details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of that part of the works:

a. Details and methods for the repair and rehanging of the rebuilt stone piers of the existing iron railings and gates. Details submitted should include, but not be limited to, fully annotated plans, sections and elevations to a scale of 1:20.

b. Samples of all external facing materials, including stone for repair to match existing stonework, new slate roofing, composite aluminium/timber glazing, glazing to Chapel entrance & new fenestration to Chetwynd Road elevation,  structural glazing, steel cladding, yellow stock brickwork. 

c. Details for the retention of commemorative stones on the Chetwynd Road facade and the granite gutter setts on the private access road.  Details submitted should include but not be limited to fully annotated plans, sections and elevations to a scale of 1:20.

d. Details of the proposed rooflights for the Chapel and Nursery hall buildings, including sizes of lights and installation details demonstrating they will be set flush with the plane of the roof and aligned with the centre of the bay windows.  Details submitted should include but not be limited to fully annotated plans, sections and elevations to a scale of 1:20.

e. Details of all roof vents and service pipes to be sited on the south pitch of the main church roof.  Details submitted should include but not be limited to fully annotated plans, sections and elevations to a scale of 1:20.

These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 EN21, EN24, EN32, EN31 & EN33 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels and details of proposed surface water run-off. 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - By not later than the end of the planting season following the completion of the development hereby permitted, or any phase of the development, trees shall be planted on the land in such positions and of such size and species as may be agreed with the Council. Any trees removed, dying, being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years of planting shall be replaced by trees of a similar size and species to those originally required to be planted.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 if landscape details and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of work on site, a scheme providing for i) the insulation of the proposed dwellings against the transmission of externally generated traffic noise and vibration from the Church and associated uses and ii) the insulation of the Sunday school to be used as the main Church function hall hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed in accordance with the approved details before the dwellings are occupied.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the premises in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage and waste removal (including recycled materials) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - The development shall not be occupied until the whole of the car parking provision shown on the approved drawings is provided. Thereafter the whole of the car parking provision shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the use of the premises does not add to parking pressures in surrounding streets which would be contrary to policies RE2  & TR17 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - A tree protection method statement shall be submitted to the Council for consideration and shall include details of how all trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least 5 years following the completion of the development hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. In particular, details shall be submitted to the Council before works commence on site to demonstrate how the trees shall be protected during construction work including the proposed highway works: such details shall for instance include measures to protect the tree trunk, to prevent additional soil compaction around the root zone, and to reduce damage to the lower branches including any proposals for crown uplifting.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000

Condition : 11 - Full details of how any internal lighting will operate within the new communal staircases/glazed link shall be submitted to the Council for approval prior to the occupation of any part of the development. This shall include details of lux levels for low level and energy efficient lighting methods and any such lighting shall operate on a sensor timer system only between 2200 to 0700 hours. Details shall be implemented as approved and retained likeso thereafter. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenity of adjoining residents in accordance with UDP policies EN19 and RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - Full details of how access for people with disabilities shall be acheived into and within all buildings at the site. Details shall also be submitted for all external areas and surfaces within the application site. 

Reason: In the interests of accessibility in accordance with UDP policy RE3 and HG14 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - The use hereby permitted shall not begin until full details of the scheme for ventilation to the premises to an adequate outlet level, including details of sound attentuation necessary for any plant have been submitted to and approved by the Council and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with these details. 

Reason: In the interests of the amenities of proposed occupiers in accordance with UDP policies RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - Before the use commences, details of a caged and lockable cycle storage area capable of holding up to 14 bicycles for shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and shall remain thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that suitable provision for cyclists is provided in accordance with the requirements of policies TR22 and DS10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - Notwithstanding the information set out in the approved drawings, nothing shall convey permission for the proposed external fire escape on the north elevation of the Sunday school building adjoining 2 Chetwynd Road. 

Reason: To mitigate against crime, particularly No. 2 Chetwynd Road in accordance with the requirements of policies EN4 and EN20 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan adopted 2000.
site_name: Former Site At Highgate Road Chapel
